description: Try our easy to follow Pork & King Prawn Lettuce Wrap recipe. Absolutely delicious with the best ingredients from Woolworths.
name: Pork & King Prawn Lettuce Wrap Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 1 bunch spring onions, green parts only, thinly sliced
400g pork belly, skin on, fat on, cut into 4cm-thick slices

recipeInstructions.text: Place the pork belly, ginger and goji berries in a saucepan and cover with water by 2cm. Bring to the boil, then gently boil over medium heat for 45 minutes or until tender. Drain the pork belly, trim off the fat, and slice the meat into 2mm-thin slices. Set aside.

Bring a large saucepan of water to the boil, add the prawns and cook for 41/2 minutes or until opaque and just-cooked through. Drain and immediately refresh in iced water. Peel and remove the tails and veins. Set aside.

To make the dipping sauce, combine all of the ingredients, except the carrot, and add lime juice to taste, in a medium bowl. If it’s too spicy, add more fish sauce. Add the carrot, stir, and let it pickle in the sauce.

To make the spring onion oil, heat the vegetable oil in a medium frying pan over medium heat. Add the spring onion and cook until softened, then add the sugar and salt, and stir to combine. Set aside.

To prepare the lettuce leaves, trim the base of each lettuce and gently peel off 12 nice-looking whole large leaves, being careful not to split the leaves. Trim each leaf to a rectangle 7cm-wide and 12cm-long. Set aside.

Prepare the noodles as per packet instructions. Drain well and cut into short lengths using kitchen scissors. To roll the wraps, place a lettuce leaf, with the base edge closest to you, on the benchtop (see tip). Place the rice vermicelli neatly on top. Spoon on the spring onion oil in a line about 2cm from the bottom of the leaf, then add a slice each of cucumber and pork belly and 1 prawn. Spoon on the pickled carrot and some of its sauce. Add some mint leaves and bean shoots. Roll up the lettuce tightly to make a log – trim any excess lettuce leaf when you get to the end. Secure with a skewer inserted sideways into the roll. Repeat with the remaining ingredients.
Serve wraps with the remaining dipping sauce on the side.
